findings.title: RSW - Redundant Storage Writes
findings.description: The contract updates the state of certain variables even if their current state is the same as the one passed as an argument, resulting in redundant storage writes.

findings.title: PVC - Price Volatility Concern
findings.description: The contract accumulates tokens from taxes to swap them for ETH, but if the `swapTokensAtAmount` variable is set to a big number, it can trigger a huge amount of token swaps, leading to significant price volatility due to the highly volatile token prices.

findings.title: AOI - Arithmetic Operations Inconsistency
findings.description: The contract uses both SafeMath library and native arithmetic operations, which can introduce inconsistencies and undermine safety measures.

findings.title: DPI - Decimals Precision Inconsistency
findings.description: Inconsistency in handling decimals field of ERC20 token can cause problems when interacting with contracts, leading to unexpected results.

findings.title: GO - Gas Optimization
findings.description: The contract variable `swapTokensAtAmount` has no input validation at the `updateSwapTokensAtAmount` function, allowing it to be set to any amount such as zero. This causes the contract to execute the swap functionality every time a transaction takes place and consume more gas.

findings.title: MEE - Missing Events Emission
findings.description: The contract performs actions and state mutations from external methods that do not result in the emission of events.

findings.title: RSML - Redundant SafeMath Library
findings.description: The usage of SafeMath library adds complexity, overhead and increases gas consumption unnecessarily since Solidity versions greater than or equal to 0.8.0 provide native functionality for arithmetic operations resistant to integer overflows and underflows.

findings.title: IDI - Immutable Declaration Improvement
findings.description: The contract declares state variables that their value is initialized once in the constructor and are not modified afterwards.

findings.title: L04 - Conformance to Solidity Naming Conventions
findings.description: The Solidity style guide provides guidelines for writing clean and consistent Solidity code. Adhering to a style guide can help improve the readability and maintainability of the Solidity code, making it easier for others to understand and work with.

findings.title: L05 - Unused State Variable
findings.description: An unused state variable is a state variable that is declared in the contract, but is never used in any of the contract's functions.

findings.title: L07 - Missing Events Arithmetic
findings.description: Events are a way to record and log information about changes or actions that occur within a contract.

findings.title: L09 - Dead Code Elimination
findings.description: Dead code can occur due to conditional statements that are always false, functions that are never called, or unreachable code, making a contract more difficult to understand and maintain, and increasing its size and deployment cost.

findings.title: L13 - Divide before Multiply Operation
findings.description: Performing divisions before multiplications may cause loss of precision.

findings.title: L14 - Uninitialized Variables in Local Scope
findings.description: Using an uninitialized local variable can lead to unpredictable behavior and potentially cause errors in the contract.

findings.title: L15 - Local Scope Variable Shadowing
findings.description: Local scope variable shadowing occurs when a local variable with the same name as a variable in an outer scope is declared within a function or code block.

findings.title: L20 - Succeeded Transfer Check
findings.description: According to the ERC20 specification, the transfer methods should be checked if the result is successful. Otherwise, the contract may wrongly assume that the transfer has been established.
